The greatest puzzle game of all time and also the greatest writing in a game ever.

So throughout playing the singleplayer campaign, I noticed something. Every single line of dialogue hits its mark. The humor and comedic timing is flawless. This game only has four main characters. One of them doesn't even talk and the the other is dead long before the events of the game actually even start and yet, these characters are so realized in their personalities. There are also no cutscenes which means you can still move around while important events play out so that's nice as well. 

The gameplay and level design is so good and playing the co-op mode on this game is a blast. Reflecting lasers back at your friend, making them go into a portal to their deaths, throwing the cube away that your friend needs to open the door to the next level. Actually, don't do that/ You'll probably lose that fore-mentioned friend and break open their sanity.

Stephen Merchant is in this game. You know, that one really British accent dude. He co-directed 'The Office'. He, um, was in Logan. He played that Albino hunchback dude.

J.K Simmons is also in it. He won that Best Supporting Actor Oscar for playing an angry music teacher in Whiplash. He was, uh, also Grunkle Stan's brother and J.Jonah.Jameson in Spiderman. You know, that laughing meme. 

Help me.
Both of them. Brilliant.

Esse jogo é simplesmente magnífico. Ele completa tudo que o primeiro, sutilmente, deixou a se imaginar. É o mesmo gameplay que conhecemos e amamos, porém amplamente acresentado por mecânicas, inimigos, e objetos novos. 

>Se você simplesmente quer alimentar o seu cérebro com puzzles complicados, porém super bem elaboradas, e recompensadoras, pode comprar agora mesmo. Uma infinidade de mapas lindas, que estão ao seu dispor, tanto sozinho, tanto com a ajuda de um amigo o tempo todo. 

>Se você quer se mergulhar num laboratório abandonado, conhecer personagens ricas de personalidades, se aprofundar nos segredos macabros do Aperture Science, e ter uma experiência capaz de mudar tudo que você achou que sabia sobre jogos, então novamente, ja pode ir comprando. 

           Dentro de um mundo estranhamente lindo, cheio do seu próprio charme, você vai se encontrar viciado, gastando horas e horas tentando completar todos os puzzles. As vezes ele vai te fazer sentir a pessoa mais estúpida do mundo, e outras vezes vai fazer você se sentir o próprio Einstein. O workshop está repleto de criações dos jogadores que você pode baixar quando quiser. O jogo lhe da a opção de criar seus próprios levels, e coçar essa vontade de ter mais puzzles. Jogar com um amigo, precisando da ajuda um do outro para completar os levels é um jogo inteiro por sí só.

           Eu recomendaria esse jogo mil vezes se eu podia. Se eu preciso pensar em algum defeito para Portal 2, eu diria que devia ser ainda mais longo, muito mais longo, até nunca acabar.

10/10

Portal 2 is an amazing game, I can play it countless times and still enjoy it. It's easily one of my top five favorite games.

The gameplay consists of using the game's various objects to complete the test chambers or, in some cases, navigate around Aperture. This gives the game a very "Puzzlesolving" sort of feel. It's extremely satisfying when you finish a test. As you progress the game will open up a ton of different ways to use the items in the chambers and the items in them. This makes a difficulty curve that requires you to think harder as time progresses, making the later Chapters oh so satisfying.

The graphics are really nice and detailed, and most computers that are worth any sort of a crap will be able to run the game at high settings. For a game from 2011, Portal 2 still manages to hold up graphically to this day. It looks great. The sound design is equally as great, with the way the sound changes depending on what the player is doing, and the stellar voice acting. The voice actors give the characters a lot of charm.

The story is good, as it takes what Portal 1 established and creates a whole world with it. Where Portal 1 was just you and GLaDOS going through tests, Portal 2 introduces new characters, backstory, and introduces the player to Aperture's "humble" beginnings.

The Co-op, while not the main part of the package, is still an enjoyable experience. It takes advantage of the fact that there are 2 players, which, by extension, means 4 portals. Most chambers require both players to use their brains to come up with the solution together. The Co-op also has its own storyline, though not exactly important. The only significant thing that truly happens is the end scene, but past that there's not much important story details to be found here.

So what happens when you're done with both the Single player and the Co-op campaigns? There's and endless amount of custom chambers via the Steam Workshop. I haven't played many of them but the ones I have played have been solid. Definitely worth a try. It's also worth mentioning that this game has many achievements for both the campaigns, and while I haven't completed them all on Steam yet, I did 100% the game on Xbox 360 and it was a blast to get every achievement.

TLDR; Buy it, it's a really good game and deserves your attention.

It's a good game overall, get on sale though, it's not worth the some twenty two bucks.

밸브의 전작인 포탈의 후속작이기 때문에 퍼즐요소가 
많은 지능형 FPS 게임인것은 그대로 유지했다.
달라진 점으로는 더 나은 그래픽, 더 장대한 스토리, 
맵 에디터와 창작마당 지원, 그리고 온라인 멀티플레이
(코옵 모드)가 있다. 그래서 스토리 모드를 모두 
마쳤다 하더라도 창작마당에서 사람들이 만든 진짜
괜찮은 맵을 플레이 할수도 있고, 친구를 불러와서 같이
협력 플레이를 할수도 있어서, 기본 플레이 타임이 꽤
긴 편이다. 근데 자주 할 만한 게임은 아니라서 그냥
하고 싶어질때 다운 받아서 하는 그런 게임이다.

En effet j'avais déjà joué a Portal 1 et avait adoré le concept et gameplay mais également l’humour du jeu en particulier "l’entraînante" Glados.

Je n'ai vraiment pas été déçus en achetant ce jeu car tout y est.
Une histoire poignante remplie de rebondissement et qui vous feras à la fois rire et tenir en haleine jusqu'au bout. Pour vous offrir une formidable fin digne des plus grands scénaristes.

De plus contrairement à son prédécesseur bien trop court à mon gout, cette suite possède une durée de vie bien plus grande et nous donne même l'occasion de jouer coopérativement avec des amis.

Mais tout cela ne s'arrête pas là vous avez même l'occasion de configurer vos propre salle (avec des possibilités presque illimité si on est prêt à y passer un peu de temps et à récupérer certains logiciels) et de pouvoir les partager avec la communauté.

Bref ma seule déception dans ce jeu c’est qu’il se finisse.

Excellent jeu, référence incontournable. Quelques niveaux sont peut-être de trop vers le milieu/fin du jeu, dans les passages avec les gels, car on peut y rester assez longtemps et au final trouver le temps long par moments.

Mais scénaristiquement, le jeu est agréable, l'ambiance est super, et cet opus est bien plus riche que le précédent, sur tous les points.

Je recommande chaudement, surtout qu'à ce prix là (surtout en soldes), il n'y a pas vraiment d'excuse.

There are very few games which consistently deliver the highest quality of experience at each and every stage.Portal 2 definitely falls within those few.
An extremely well written and often times hilarious storyline sets the backdrop for brilliantly designed puzzle set pieces.They are always challenging but never unfair.There is no repetition of puzzles and there'll come no part where you get tired of solving them.
All these qualities are prominently on display in the cooperative missions aswell.These missions focus on team play and leave you with immense satisfaction after figuring out the solution with your partner.
And you'll never run out of content even after finishing the base game thanks to the ingame level editor.
Thousands of commnity made singleplayer and coop levels can be freely downloaded and enjoyed at your own pace.
Bonus - You can also play with your friends locally thanks to splitscreen offline coop. :)
Bastante complicado y eso lo hace divertido, la personalidad de glados esta bien marcada y es el único "Villano" de los videojuegos que no me parece tan malo
